newsitem.title: KENYA: Nairobi bourse index, turnover up.
newsitem.headline: Nairobi bourse index, turnover up.

text.p: The Nairobi Stock Exchange (NSE) 20-share index gained 15.91 points to close at 3379.31 on increased demand for key shares, bourse officials said.
Turnover rose to 48.011 million shillings on 1,039,260 shares from 12.96 million shillings on 315,249 shares Monday.
"There are a lot of buying positions in the market," a senior broker said. "A lot of investors think there's room in our market for prices to really go up," he added.

The launch of Tourism Promotion Services (TPS) has also boosted the market, floor dealers said. Serena Lodges & Hotels, floated in March and traded for the first time on Monday, will trade on the bourse under the TPS name.
TPS is majority owned by the Aga Khan.
"It (TPS) has sparked up a huge interest. Market activity really picked and I think this excitement is travelling across the boards," a bourse official said .
TPS closed at 18.60 from 19.65 while Uchumi Supermarkets was unchanged at 41.25.
Barclays Bank edged up by a shilling to close at 116 while Kenya Commercial Bank gained 3.0 to close at 95. Standard Chartered Bank closed at 46 from 45.75.
Rea Vipingo eased to 8.90 from 9.0 while Brooke Bond lost a shilling to close at 125
"Anybody who is buying now is making a really brave and positive bet that elections will run smoothly and is confident that the only for the economy is forward," a broker said.
Kenya's general elections will be held sometime this year. President Daniel arap Moi, in power since 1978, is firm favourite to stay in power.
Kenya Breweries eased to 58.50 from 60 from while Kenya Power & Lighting gained a shilling to close at 130. Total Kenya was unchanged at 65.
The Central Bank of Kenya floating rate treasury bond traded 50,000 at 103 percent from 102.9999 percent.
